intro: Piper coriaceilimbum, commonly known as the rough-leaved pepper vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes many species of pepper plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, rough-textured leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into berry-like fruits. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
